info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 18 at 10:40PM EDT until July 19 at 4:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington OH
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Southern Warren County, Ohio.
* WHEN...Until 400 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1036 PM EDT, radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain had occurred. Local officials have reported that numerous roads are closed in southern Warren County. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Morrow, Maineville, Zoar, Mason, Lebanon, South Lebanon, Loveland, Butlerville, Pleasant Plain, Murdock, Dallasburg, Middleboro, Kings Mills and Landen.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EDT SATURDAY... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING
